name: Ratings
description: Professional rating system for Jellyfin. Rate media with 1-10 stars, view detailed user ratings on hover, and see rating badges on media cards. Optimized for large libraries with lazy loading.
overview: Comprehensive rating plugin with star-based UI, average ratings display, detailed user rating popups, and performance-optimized card overlays for large media libraries.

versions.changelog: Mobile responsive! Request Media button now 70% smaller on mobile devices (screens under 768px), positioned to the right for better fit. Desktop unchanged.
Perfect positioning (top: 8px), working shine animation with gradient sweep, smart badge that disappears when you view completed requests! All polished and working smoothly.
Stunning shine animation! Button aligned with header, no icon, text shines with gradient sweep. Badge updates instantly when admin marks requests as done. Beautiful & functional!
Premium UX! Grey centered button with pulse animation, notification badges (admins see pending count, users see completed count), super compact tables, wider modal. Professional look!
Enhanced Request Media: Button moved left, tooltip on hover, dropdown type selector (Movie/TV Series/Anime/etc), description box, users see their own requests with live status updates!
Full Request Media system! User interface for submitting requests, admin interface for managing requests with status updates (pending/processing/done). Button repositioned to avoid blocking UI.
SAFE Request Media button! Fully isolated with error handling, won't crash Jellyfin. Top-right corner, hides during video.
Improved mobile/tablet layout with margin-left: 136px at max-width: 1312px for better positioning.
Fixed mobile layout! Rating stars now display properly on mobile devices with responsive design.
Removed all console logging for production. Clean and optimized code.
FIXED: Series rating badges now working! Series items have data-isfolder=true but are valid media items.
DEBUG VERSION: Added extensive console logging to diagnose series card detection issues.
Enhanced card detection using data-id attributes. More reliable detection of series and movie cards.
Fixed rating badges not appearing on TV series cards. Improved URL filtering to allow series-specific links.
